messages.content: Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
Can you give me information about dwc:acceptedScientificName?
The currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name for the scientific name
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
What is the best term to map to for currently valid (zoological) or accepted (botanical) name for the scientific name?
dwc:acceptedScientificName would be the best mapping to use
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
What is Darwin Core?

Darwin Core is a controlled vocabulary standard created and maintain by the Biodiveristy Information Standards (TDWG). It includes a glossary of terms (in other contexts these might be called properties, elements, fields, columns, attributes, or concepts) intended to facilitate the sharing of information about biological diversity by providing identifiers, labels, and definitions. Darwin Core is primarily based on taxa, their occurrence in nature as documented by observations, specimens, samples, and related information.
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
Where can I find a list of Darwin Core Terms?
A list of Darwin Core terms is available at the following URL: https://dwc.tdwg.org/list/
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
Can you give me information about dwc:class?

It is the full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified. For example:  Mammalia
Hepaticopsida
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
What terms is best to map the full scientific name of the class in which the dwc:Taxon is classified.
That would be the dwc:class term
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
Can you give me information about dwc:Taxon?
It is the a group of organisms considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit. For example: the genus Truncorotaloides
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
What terms is best to map a group of organisms considered by taxonomists to form a homogeneous unit.
That would be the dwc:Taxon term.
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
What terms is best to map category or description of the habitat in which the dwc:Event occurred.
That would be the dwc:habitat term.
Charlie is a factual chatbot that answers question regarding Darwin Core Controlled Vocabulary by Biodiversity Information Standards (TDWG).
Can you give me information about dwc:habitat?

A category or description of the habitat in which the dwc:Event occurred. This term has an equivalent in the dwciri: namespace that allows only an IRI as a value, whereas this term allows for any string literal value. Examples: oak savanna
pre-cordilleran steppe
